Welcome to an Engaged Community

There's a better way to personalize your website experience. City Offices to be Closed Good Friday
Fort Madison City offices will be closed Friday, April 19 in observance of Good Friday. All departments will reopen Monday, April 22, 2019. Friday's garbage route pick-up will be on Monday, April 22, 2019 as well as the normal Monday garbage route.
2019 Fort Madison Spring Clean-Up
Dates for the 2019 Spring Clean-Up are May 10 through May 18. Read on...
Fort Madison to Flush Fire Hydrants
The Fort Madison Water Department will start it's semi-annual fire hydrant flushing on Monday, April 29, 2019 at 7:00 A.M. The hydrant flushing will continue through Friday, May 3, 2019 at 3:00 P.M. Read on...
It's Spring, Have You Thought About Adopting a City Garden?
Fort Madison Parks Department is looking for citizens to help keep the city pretty throughout the rest of the year by adopting a city garden. Read on...

Sign Up for Our New Notification System

  1. Help us keep you informed in the event of an emergency, severe weather, or other important City information. Sign up to receive our notifications. If you were previously signed up for the HVPD E-Watch, Water Conservation, Community Alerts or Street Construction you will select "forgot password" and then follow the steps to update your account.  

Highland Village Latest News

  1. Events Cancelled Due to Inclement Weather

    Due to forecast of inclement weather on April 13, the Easter Egg Hunt has been postponed to April 20 and the Rails to Trails event has been cancelled with plans to reschedule for June 1.

  2. City Invites the Community to Kick Off Meeting for the Copperas Branch Park Master Plan

    The City has begun the master plan process for Copperas Branch Park and invites the community to a kick off meeting on Thursday, April 18, at Doubletree Ranch Park from 6:30 p.m. – 9:00 p.m. Help us with the big ideas for the re-development of the park. Additional Info...

  3. How Does Proposed Senate Bill/House Bill 2 Impact Highland Village?

    On Thursday, April 11, the Texas House will discuss and vote on a bill that will reduce City revenue by $.5M and hinder our ability to provide essential City services. Homeowners will save an average of $85/year. This is not meaningful tax relief. Additional Info...

  4. FM 2499 to Close for KCS Railroad Crossing Repair

    On April 9 southbound and northbound FM2499 will be closed to vehicular traffic starting at 6 a.m. for the repair of the FM2499 railroad crossing. Southbound FM2499 will be closed at Swisher Rd, Highland Shores Blvd & northbound FM2499 at Harlingen Dr. Read on...

  5. City Seeks to Engage with the Community

    Better decisions are made when the community provides input. The City's new online engagement tool, Speak Up HV, makes that easy. Users can contribute ideas and ask questions about featured projects, at times that work best for them. Read on...

  6. Citizens Receive Certificate of Merit Award

    On Feb. 28 Zachary Harris, Lorenzo Rios, Dylan Martin, and Mary Smith all stopped to intervene with a person who was in desperate need of help. Each were presented the Citizen Certificate of Merit Award for their actions that saved someone’s life. Additional Info...

  7. Highland Village Announces Enhanced Emergency Notification Solution

    Highland Village has launched a new version of its emergency preparedness and mass notification services for citizens. The new solution, CivicReady, has significantly improved. We are asking all residents to ensure they are signed up for communication. Additional Info...

  8. Highland Village Appoints Michael Thomson as Fire Chief

    On February 26, City Council approved the appointment by the City Manager of Michael Thomson as Fire Chief for the City of Highland Village. Chief Thomson will begin in Highland Village on March 11. Additional Info...

  9. 2019 State of the City - Pathway to Leadership

    The 2019 State of the City, Pathway to Leadership, focuses on what has occurred and what is on the horizon for the City. In this year's video Mayor Wilcox informs LISD students of the state of Highland Village and the opportunities for their involvement. Read on...

  10. Highland Village Parks Foundation to Donate Funds for Kids Kastle Entrance Feature

    On February 12, Austin Adams, President of the Highland Village Parks Foundation, presented the Foundation’s intent to donate $125,000 to the City of Highland Village to partially fund construction of the entrance feature for Kids Kastle at Unity Park. Additional Info...

  11. Highland Village and Flower Mound Enter Into Automatic Aid Agreement

    Highland Village and Flower Mound Fire Departments enter into agreement where HVFD provides emergency medical services to Flower Mound residential areas near the Highland Village border and FMFD provides second engine to HV for commercial fire calls. Read on...

  12. City Announces 2018 Photo Contest Winners

    The City’s annual “Give Us Your Best Shot Photo Contest” has just come to a close and the winners are ready to be announced. Each year, Highland Village encourages people to submit their best shots from the year into the contest for cash prizes. Additional Info...

  13. City Provides TPCA Foundation Donation from TXFallenPD Tribute Event

    On December 12, police chief Doug Reim presented a check in the amount of $58,573.76 to a Texas Police Chiefs Association Foundation representative. The donation is the culmination of the 2018 TXFallenPD Tribute Event which was held on October 20, 2018. Additional Info...

  14. Council Honors Local Veterans at the Honor Our Veterans Ceremony

    Additional Info...

  15. Council Receives Update on Public Safety Response Times

    At the October 9 meeting, Council received an update on Public Safety response times. Highland Village Public Safety response times now exceed the industry standard 99% of the time, moving from 96% in 2015, and 97% in 2016. Additional Info...

  16. Council Approves FY 2018-2019 Budget Which Includes Tax Decrease

    Council approves the FY 2018-2019 Budget, decreasing the ad valorem tax rate to $0.56302; approves resolution to purchase new fire engine and ambulance; appoints members to city boards and commissions. Additional Info...
View All
